PS. We had to do a picture story... and I have to figure a way to put the .mov file somewhere that I can show it. Mine was funny, but kinda sad.
OK so it's the end of the session already.... we have to turn in 10 final images. 8 taken with our dslr and 2 with our 4x5 view cameras.
The pictures and to follow the project classifications of this session, and had to be taken this session ,obviously. No more than two images from the same project, could be turned in either.They did not have to be images we turned in previously. I  turned in some new and some old . This was big pressure, because if the images were technically wrong in any aspect ,we fail the class.... yeah stress-city. So I still don't know my grades.

So we had to turn in a final self portrait for extra credit. In order to get credit it had to be creative, and fit all the qualifications of a good image.

So I decided to have fun with mine.

1.

We had a couple assignments that we had to use the 4x5 view camera. I will post those somewhere else when I get the time to scan them. Until then I'll go onto the next digital assignment, WIndow Light Portraiture.  Simply we had to use a window to  act a diffuser creating soft split lighting on our subject. We had to turn in 2 digital and 1 4x5.

1.
2.

In this project we had to use three methods of subject isolation and then show the opposite effect of the same shot. The three methods are: subject blur, subject pan, and subject selective focus.

OK, so here is my first Journal Post. This is not going to be anything special.

Alright so I created this live journal account so I could post projects from my experience here at brooks institute. I may post daily events , but generally this will be a forum for assignment products. Our first assignment is  "A day in the life of Santa Barbara" When I am done deciding which pictures I will turn in, I will post them here. Our next assignment is "Line, Shape, Texture." Honestly this sounds like it will be fun. SO... If you wanna know more personal details about my time here in Santa Barbara... contact me via my-space or face-book.


Peace Out
Stephen.
